messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] thanks, everybody
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/10/2002 9:58:09 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... I think it might be VERY useful for you to modify Carol Narigon s Unschooling Curriculum
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/10/2002 9:58:09 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
abtleo@... writes:


> Does anybody else regularly deal with unsupportive family members? Any
> suggestions? (My solutions this week included deafness -- it's amazing the
> things I just didn't "hear" <g> and saying "mmmm" a lot -- the ultimate
> non-commital answer.)

I think it might be VERY useful for you to modify Carol Narigon's
"Unschooling Curriculum" write-up and print it on some lovely paper, making
it look very official (if not officious <g>) and give that to your family
members.
http://sandradodd.com/unschoolingcurriculum.html

--pamS


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: thanks, everybody
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks to everyone for support about school NOT being what my folks keep telling me it is.  I just got discouraged with them, and the HSLDA discussion was not
messages.messageBody:
Thanks to everyone for support about school NOT being what my folks keep
telling me it is. I just got discouraged with them, and the HSLDA
discussion was not exactly uplifting and encouraging for a stressed,
depressed parent! ;)

I know in my heart that unschooling is so right for us, but constant
negative feedback does get to me after awhile. I can't get them to even
read about or consider the possibilities of unschooling, so I'm not getting
very far on that end.

Does anybody else regularly deal with unsupportive family members? Any
suggestions? (My solutions this week included deafness -- it's amazing the
things I just didn't "hear" <g> and saying "mmmm" a lot -- the ultimate
non-commital answer.)

Anyhow, thanks!
brenda
who's very happy to be back with hubby and not with parents!
